text:
<@U02K79G4BC3> The only explanation that make sense, as long nothing else is documented*, is that the parameter "region" point the server location. "na1" = North America 1Â and "eu1" = Europe 1. I guess the parameter depending on the host location of the HubSpot Instance and is related to the data policy restrictions of the European Union. But I would not guarantee that as long as a HubSpot developer agrees.

*documentation:
<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/advanced_form_options>

Hello,
I am taking inputs of date, time and timezone from user in a html form.
I want to convert it to the unix timestamp for the specific timezone entered.
Can someone help me with this. How can I do this efficiently?
